data.title: Security Council Unanimously Agrees to Recommend Membership of Lesotho and Botswana to United Nations
data.meta_description:
The Security Council voted unanimously this afternoon to recommend to the General Assembly the admission of Botswana and Lesotho to the United Nations. 

Chief S.O. Adebo (Nigeria) making the first statement in support of the two draft resolutions before the Council. On the left is Mr. F.H. Corner (New Zealand), and at the right is
data.meta_site_name: Permanent Mission of Nigeria to the United Nations, New York
data.text:
The Security Council voted unanimously this afternoon to recommend to the General Assembly the admission of Botswana and Lesotho to the United Nations.

Chief S.O. Adebo (Nigeria) making the first statement in support of the two draft resolutions before the Council. On the left is Mr. F.H. Corner (New Zealand), and at the right is Apollo K. Kironde (Uganda).

14 October 1966

United Nations, New York
